interpretation_philosophy: We present facts from reliable sources (primarily Wikipedia) with transparent source attribution. For controversial topics, we acknowledge the controversy and present the mainstream scientific/historical consensus while noting that interpretations may vary.

facts.statement: World War I lasted from 1914 to 1918

source.summary: WWI was a global conflict from July 28, 1914 to November 11, 1918

facts.interpretation_note: Dates are historically documented and undisputed.

facts.statement: World War II lasted from 1939 to 1945

source.summary: WWII was a global conflict from September 1, 1939 to September 2, 1945

facts.interpretation_note: Dates are historically documented and undisputed.

source.summary: First cases identified in Wuhan, China in December 2019

facts.statement: Biological sex in humans is primarily determined by sex chromosomes

value.intersex_note: Intersex variations exist (estimates ~0.018-1.7% depending on definition)

source.summary: Human sex chromosomes are X and Y; typical patterns are XX (female) and XY (male)

facts.interpretation_note: This describes biological sex based on chromosomes. Gender identity is a separate concept related to psychological and social identity. Intersex variations exist. This is a complex topic with biological, social, and personal dimensions.

facts.statement: Normal human body temperature is approximately 37°C (98.6°F)

value.note: Varies by individual, time of day, and measurement method

source.summary: Average oral temperature is about 36.8°C (98.2°F); traditional 37°C is slightly high

facts.interpretation_note: Well-established medical fact, though exact values vary slightly.

facts.statement: Speed of light in vacuum is approximately 299,792 km/s

source.summary: The speed of light in vacuum is exactly 299,792,458 m/s by definition

facts.interpretation_note: Fundamental physical constant, precisely defined and measured.

facts.statement: Acceleration due to gravity on Earth is approximately 9.8 m/s²

value.note: Varies slightly by location (9.76 to 9.83 m/s²)

source.summary: Standard gravity is defined as 9.80665 m/s²

facts.statement: Water boils at 100°C (212°F) at standard atmospheric pressure

value.note: Boiling point varies with altitude and pressure

source.summary: Water boils at 100°C at sea level pressure

facts.statement: There are 8 planets in the Solar System (since 2006)

value.note: Pluto was reclassified as a dwarf planet in 2006
